1: %% @doc Common Test Suite for RouterAdmin gRPC Integration Tests
    2: -module(router_admin_grpc_integration_SUITE).
    3: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
    4: -include_lib("eunit/include/eunit.hrl").
    5: 
    6: %% Use local minimal test types to avoid include path issues
    7: -include("beamline_router_test_types.hrl").
    8: -include("../include/flow_pb.hrl").
    9: -include_lib("grpcbox/include/grpcbox.hrl").
   10: -include("router_grpc_test_helper.hrl").
   11: 
   12: -compile(export_all).
   13: 
   14: %% Test suite callbacks
   15: all() ->
   16:     [
   17:         test_upsert_policy_success,
   18:         test_upsert_policy_invalid_weights,
   19:         test_upsert_policy_unauthorized,
   20:         test_upsert_policy_invalid_key,
   21:         test_upsert_policy_invalid_format,
   22:         test_delete_policy_success,
   23:         test_delete_policy_not_found,
   24:         test_get_policy_success,
   25:         test_get_policy_not_found,
   26:         test_list_policies_success,
   27:         test_upsert_and_decide_integration,
   28:         test_delete_and_decide_integration,
   29:         test_admin_telemetry_correlation_id
   30:         %% Future: test_permission_denied - when role/scope model is implemented
   31:     ].
   32: 
   33: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   34:     %% Start application with ephemeral port
   35:     _ = application:load(beamline_router),  %% Ignore if already loaded
   36:     ok = application:set_env(beamline_router, grpc_port, 0),  %% Ephemeral port
   37:     ok = application:set_env(beamline_router, admin_api_key, <<"test-admin-key">>),
   38:     {ok, _} = application:ensure_all_started(beamline_router),
   39:     
   40:     %% Wait for gRPC server to start
   41:     timer:sleep(1000),
   42:     
   43:     %% Get actual port (fallback to default if not available)
   44:     ActualPort = case application:get_env(beamline_router, grpc_port) of
   45:         {ok, P} when is_integer(P), P > 0 -> P;
   46:         _ -> 9000  %% Fallback
   47:     end,
   48:     
   49:     [{grpc_port, ActualPort}, {admin_api_key, <<"test-admin-key">>} | Config].
   50: 
   51: end_per_suite(Config) ->
   52:     application:stop(beamline_router),
   53:     Config.
   54: 
   55: %% Test: UpsertPolicy success
   56: test_upsert_policy_success(Config) ->
   57:     AdminKey = proplists:get_value(admin_api_key, Config),
   58:     TenantId = <<"test_tenant">>,
   59:     
   60:     %% Create AdminPolicy
   61:     AdminPolicyPb = #'AdminPolicy'{
   62:         policy_id = <<"test_policy">>,
   63:         providers = [
   64:             #'AdminProvider'{id = <<"openai">>, weight = 0.7},
   65:             #'AdminProvider'{id = <<"anthropic">>, weight = 0.3}
   66:         ],
   67:         sticky = false,
   68:         rules = []
   69:     },
   70:     
   71:     RequestPb = #'UpsertPolicyRequest'{
   72:         tenant_id = TenantId,
   73:         policy = AdminPolicyPb
   74:     },
   75:     
   76:     Request = flow_pb:encode_msg(RequestPb, 'UpsertPolicyRequest'),
   77:     
   78:     %% Call gRPC method directly (simulating client call)
   79:     Ctx = create_context_with_auth(AdminKey),
   80:     Result = router_admin_grpc:upsert_policy(Ctx, Request),
   81:     
   82:     ?assertMatch({ok, _Response, _Ctx}, Result),
   83:     {ok, Response, _} = Result,
   84:     
   85:     %% Decode response
   86:     ResponsePb = flow_pb:decode_msg(Response, 'UpsertPolicyResponse'),
   87:     ?assertEqual(true, ResponsePb#'UpsertPolicyResponse'.ok),
   88:     
   89:     ok.
   90: 
   91: %% Test: UpsertPolicy invalid weights
   92: test_upsert_policy_invalid_weights(Config) ->
   93:     AdminKey = proplists:get_value(admin_api_key, Config),
   94:     TenantId = <<"test_tenant">>,
   95:     
   96:     %% Create AdminPolicy with invalid weight (> 1.0)
   97:     AdminPolicyPb = #'AdminPolicy'{
   98:         policy_id = <<"invalid_policy">>,
   99:         providers = [
  100:             #'AdminProvider'{id = <<"openai">>, weight = 1.5}  %% Invalid
  101:         ],
  102:         sticky = false,
  103:         rules = []
  104:     },
  105:     
  106:     RequestPb = #'UpsertPolicyRequest'{
  107:         tenant_id = TenantId,
  108:         policy = AdminPolicyPb
  109:     },
  110:     
  111:     Request = flow_pb:encode_msg(RequestPb, 'UpsertPolicyRequest'),
  112:     
  113:     Ctx = create_context_with_auth(AdminKey),
  114:     
  115:     %% Should throw grpc_error with INVALID_ARGUMENT
  116:     try
  117:         router_admin_grpc:upsert_policy(Ctx, Request),
  118:         ?assert(false, "Should have thrown grpc_error")
  119:     catch
  120:         {grpc_error, {Status, _Message}} ->
  121:             ?assertEqual(?GRPC_STATUS_INVALID_ARGUMENT, Status)
  122:     end,
  123:     
  124:     ok.
  125: 
  126: %% Test: UpsertPolicy unauthorized (no key)
  127: test_upsert_policy_unauthorized(Config) ->
  128:     TenantId = <<"test_tenant">>,
  129:     
  130:     AdminPolicyPb = #'AdminPolicy'{
  131:         policy_id = <<"test_policy">>,
  132:         providers = [
  133:             #'AdminProvider'{id = <<"openai">>, weight = 0.7}
  134:         ],
  135:         sticky = false,
  136:         rules = []
  137:     },
  138:     
  139:     RequestPb = #'UpsertPolicyRequest'{
  140:         tenant_id = TenantId,
  141:         policy = AdminPolicyPb
  142:     },
  143:     
  144:     Request = flow_pb:encode_msg(RequestPb, 'UpsertPolicyRequest'),
  145:     
  146:     %% Create context without auth
  147:     Ctx = create_context_without_auth(),
  148:     
  149:     %% Should throw grpc_error with UNAUTHENTICATED
  150:     try
  151:         router_admin_grpc:upsert_policy(Ctx, Request),
  152:         ?assert(false, "Should have thrown grpc_error")
  153:     catch
  154:         {grpc_error, {Status, _Message}} ->
  155:             ?assertEqual(?GRPC_STATUS_UNAUTHENTICATED, Status)
  156:     end,
  157:     
  158:     ok.
  159: 
  160: %% Test: UpsertPolicy unauthorized (invalid key)
  161: test_upsert_policy_invalid_key(Config) ->
  162:     TenantId = <<"test_tenant">>,
  163:     
  164:     AdminPolicyPb = #'AdminPolicy'{
  165:         policy_id = <<"test_policy">>,
  166:         providers = [
  167:             #'AdminProvider'{id = <<"openai">>, weight = 0.7}
  168:         ],
  169:         sticky = false,
  170:         rules = []
  171:     },
  172:     
  173:     RequestPb = #'UpsertPolicyRequest'{
  174:         tenant_id = TenantId,
  175:         policy = AdminPolicyPb
  176:     },
  177:     
  178:     Request = flow_pb:encode_msg(RequestPb, 'UpsertPolicyRequest'),
  179:     
  180:     %% Create context with invalid key
  181:     Ctx = create_context_with_auth(<<"wrong-key">>),
  182:     
  183:     %% Should throw grpc_error with UNAUTHENTICATED
  184:     try
  185:         router_admin_grpc:upsert_policy(Ctx, Request),
  186:         ?assert(false, "Should have thrown grpc_error")
  187:     catch
  188:         {grpc_error, {Status, _Message}} ->
  189:             ?assertEqual(?GRPC_STATUS_UNAUTHENTICATED, Status)
  190:     end,
  191:     
  192:     ok.
  193: 
  194: %% Test: UpsertPolicy unauthorized (invalid format - empty key)
  195: %% Empty key should still return UNAUTHENTICATED, not INVALID_ARGUMENT
  196: test_upsert_policy_invalid_format(Config) ->
  197:     TenantId = <<"test_tenant">>,
  198:     
  199:     AdminPolicyPb = #'AdminPolicy'{
  200:         policy_id = <<"test_policy">>,
  201:         providers = [
  202:             #'AdminProvider'{id = <<"openai">>, weight = 0.7}
  203:         ],
  204:         sticky = false,
  205:         rules = []
  206:     },
  207:     
  208:     RequestPb = #'UpsertPolicyRequest'{
  209:         tenant_id = TenantId,
  210:         policy = AdminPolicyPb
  211:     },
  212:     
  213:     Request = flow_pb:encode_msg(RequestPb, 'UpsertPolicyRequest'),
  214:     
  215:     %% Test various malformed auth formats - all should return UNAUTHENTICATED
  216:     
  217:     %% Test 1: Empty x-api-key
  218:     Ctx1 = #{metadata => [{<<"x-api-key">>, <<>>}]},
  219:     test_auth_returns_unauthorized(Ctx1, Request, "empty x-api-key"),
  220:     
  221:     %% Test 2: Empty Bearer token
  222:     Ctx2 = #{metadata => [{<<"authorization">>, <<"Bearer ">>}]},
  223:     test_auth_returns_unauthorized(Ctx2, Request, "empty Bearer token"),
  224:     
  225:     %% Test 3: Bearer with only whitespace
  226:     Ctx3 = #{metadata => [{<<"authorization">>, <<"Bearer  ">>}]},
  227:     test_auth_returns_unauthorized(Ctx3, Request, "Bearer with whitespace"),
  228:     
  229:     %% Test 4: Bearer with tab
  230:     Ctx4 = #{metadata => [{<<"authorization">>, <<"Bearer\t">>}]},
  231:     test_auth_returns_unauthorized(Ctx4, Request, "Bearer with tab"),
  232:     
  233:     %% Test 5: Just "Bearer" without space
  234:     Ctx5 = #{metadata => [{<<"authorization">>, <<"Bearer">>}]},
  235:     test_auth_returns_unauthorized(Ctx5, Request, "Bearer without space"),
  236:     
  237:     ok.
  238: 
  239: %% Helper: Test that auth error returns UNAUTHENTICATED, not INVALID_ARGUMENT
  240: test_auth_returns_unauthorized(Ctx, Request, Description) ->
  241:     try
  242:         router_admin_grpc:upsert_policy(Ctx, Request),
  243:         ct:fail("Should have thrown grpc_error for ~s", [Description])
  244:     catch
  245:         {grpc_error, {Status, Message}} ->
  246:             ?assertEqual(?GRPC_STATUS_UNAUTHENTICATED, Status, 
  247:                         io_lib:format("~s should return UNAUTHENTICATED, not INVALID_ARGUMENT", [Description])),
  248:             %% Verify it's not INVALID_ARGUMENT
  249:             ?assertNotEqual(?GRPC_STATUS_INVALID_ARGUMENT, Status,
  250:                            io_lib:format("Should not be INVALID_ARGUMENT for auth issues: ~s", [Description])),
  251:             ct:log("~s: Received UNAUTHENTICATED (correct) with message: ~p", [Description, Message])
  252:     end.
  253: 
  254: %% Test: DeletePolicy success
  255: test_delete_policy_success(Config) ->
  256:     AdminKey = proplists:get_value(admin_api_key, Config),
  257:     TenantId = <<"test_tenant">>,
  258:     PolicyId = <<"delete_test">>,
  259:     
  260:     %% Create policy first
  261:     AdminPolicyPb = #'AdminPolicy'{
  262:         policy_id = PolicyId,
  263:         providers = [
  264:             #'AdminProvider'{id = <<"openai">>, weight = 0.7}
  265:         ],
  266:         sticky = false,
  267:         rules = []
  268:     },
  269:     
  270:     UpsertRequestPb = #'UpsertPolicyRequest'{
  271:         tenant_id = TenantId,
  272:         policy = AdminPolicyPb
  273:     },
  274:     
  275:     UpsertRequest = flow_pb:encode_msg(UpsertRequestPb, 'UpsertPolicyRequest'),
  276:     Ctx = create_context_with_auth(AdminKey),
  277:     {ok, _, _} = router_admin_grpc:upsert_policy(Ctx, UpsertRequest),
  278:     
  279:     %% Delete policy
  280:     DeleteRequestPb = #'DeletePolicyRequest'{
  281:         tenant_id = TenantId,
  282:         policy_id = PolicyId
  283:     },
  284:     
  285:     DeleteRequest = flow_pb:encode_msg(DeleteRequestPb, 'DeletePolicyRequest'),
  286:     Result = router_admin_grpc:delete_policy(Ctx, DeleteRequest),
  287:     
  288:     ?assertMatch({ok, _Response, _Ctx}, Result),
  289:     {ok, Response, _} = Result,
  290:     
  291:     ResponsePb = flow_pb:decode_msg(Response, 'DeletePolicyResponse'),
  292:     ?assertEqual(true, ResponsePb#'DeletePolicyResponse'.ok),
  293:     
  294:     ok.
  295: 
  296: %% Test: DeletePolicy not found
  297: test_delete_policy_not_found(Config) ->
  298:     AdminKey = proplists:get_value(admin_api_key, Config),
  299:     TenantId = <<"test_tenant">>,
  300:     PolicyId = <<"nonexistent">>,
  301:     
  302:     DeleteRequestPb = #'DeletePolicyRequest'{
  303:         tenant_id = TenantId,
  304:         policy_id = PolicyId
  305:     },
  306:     
  307:     DeleteRequest = flow_pb:encode_msg(DeleteRequestPb, 'DeletePolicyRequest'),
  308:     Ctx = create_context_with_auth(AdminKey),
  309:     
  310:     %% Should throw grpc_error with NOT_FOUND
  311:     try
  312:         router_admin_grpc:delete_policy(Ctx, DeleteRequest),
  313:         ?assert(false, "Should have thrown grpc_error")
  314:     catch
  315:         {grpc_error, {Status, _Message}} ->
  316:             ?assertEqual(?GRPC_STATUS_NOT_FOUND, Status)
  317:     end,
  318:     
  319:     ok.
  320: 
  321: %% Test: GetPolicy success
  322: test_get_policy_success(Config) ->
  323:     AdminKey = proplists:get_value(admin_api_key, Config),
  324:     TenantId = <<"test_tenant">>,
  325:     PolicyId = <<"get_test">>,
  326:     
  327:     %% Create policy first
  328:     AdminPolicyPb = #'AdminPolicy'{
  329:         policy_id = PolicyId,
  330:         providers = [
  331:             #'AdminProvider'{id = <<"openai">>, weight = 0.7},
  332:             #'AdminProvider'{id = <<"anthropic">>, weight = 0.3}
  333:         ],
  334:         sticky = true,
  335:         rules = []
  336:     },
  337:     
  338:     UpsertRequestPb = #'UpsertPolicyRequest'{
  339:         tenant_id = TenantId,
  340:         policy = AdminPolicyPb
  341:     },
  342:     
  343:     UpsertRequest = flow_pb:encode_msg(UpsertRequestPb, 'UpsertPolicyRequest'),
  344:     Ctx = create_context_with_auth(AdminKey),
  345:     {ok, _, _} = router_admin_grpc:upsert_policy(Ctx, UpsertRequest),
  346:     
  347:     %% Get policy
  348:     GetRequestPb = #'GetPolicyRequest'{
  349:         tenant_id = TenantId,
  350:         policy_id = PolicyId
  351:     },
  352:     
  353:     GetRequest = flow_pb:encode_msg(GetRequestPb, 'GetPolicyRequest'),
  354:     Result = router_admin_grpc:get_policy(Ctx, GetRequest),
  355:     
  356:     ?assertMatch({ok, _Response, _Ctx}, Result),
  357:     {ok, Response, _} = Result,
  358:     
  359:     ResponsePb = flow_pb:decode_msg(Response, 'GetPolicyResponse'),
  360:     RetrievedPolicy = ResponsePb#'GetPolicyResponse'.policy,
  361:     ?assertEqual(PolicyId, RetrievedPolicy#'AdminPolicy'.policy_id),
  362:     ?assertEqual(2, length(RetrievedPolicy#'AdminPolicy'.providers)),
  363:     
  364:     ok.
  365: 
  366: %% Test: GetPolicy not found
  367: test_get_policy_not_found(Config) ->
  368:     AdminKey = proplists:get_value(admin_api_key, Config),
  369:     TenantId = <<"test_tenant">>,
  370:     PolicyId = <<"nonexistent">>,
  371:     
  372:     GetRequestPb = #'GetPolicyRequest'{
  373:         tenant_id = TenantId,
  374:         policy_id = PolicyId
  375:     },
  376:     
  377:     GetRequest = flow_pb:encode_msg(GetRequestPb, 'GetPolicyRequest'),
  378:     Ctx = create_context_with_auth(AdminKey),
  379:     
  380:     %% Should throw grpc_error with NOT_FOUND
  381:     try
  382:         router_admin_grpc:get_policy(Ctx, GetRequest),
  383:         ?assert(false, "Should have thrown grpc_error")
  384:     catch
  385:         {grpc_error, {Status, _Message}} ->
  386:             ?assertEqual(?GRPC_STATUS_NOT_FOUND, Status)
  387:     end,
  388:     
  389:     ok.
  390: 
  391: %% Test: ListPolicies success
  392: test_list_policies_success(Config) ->
  393:     AdminKey = proplists:get_value(admin_api_key, Config),
  394:     TenantId = <<"list_test_tenant">>,
  395:     
  396:     %% Create multiple policies
  397:     Policy1 = #'AdminPolicy'{
  398:         policy_id = <<"list_policy1">>,
  399:         providers = [#'AdminProvider'{id = <<"openai">>, weight = 0.7}],
  400:         sticky = false,
  401:         rules = []
  402:     },
  403:     
  404:     Policy2 = #'AdminPolicy'{
  405:         policy_id = <<"list_policy2">>,
  406:         providers = [#'AdminProvider'{id = <<"anthropic">>, weight = 0.5}],
  407:         sticky = false,
  408:         rules = []
  409:     },
  410:     
  411:     Ctx = create_context_with_auth(AdminKey),
  412:     
  413:     UpsertRequest1Pb = #'UpsertPolicyRequest'{
  414:         tenant_id = TenantId,
  415:         policy = Policy1
  416:     },
  417:     UpsertRequest2Pb = #'UpsertPolicyRequest'{
  418:         tenant_id = TenantId,
  419:         policy = Policy2
  420:     },
  421:     
  422:     UpsertRequest1 = flow_pb:encode_msg(UpsertRequest1Pb, 'UpsertPolicyRequest'),
  423:     UpsertRequest2 = flow_pb:encode_msg(UpsertRequest2Pb, 'UpsertPolicyRequest'),
  424:     
  425:     {ok, _, _} = router_admin_grpc:upsert_policy(Ctx, UpsertRequest1),
  426:     {ok, _, _} = router_admin_grpc:upsert_policy(Ctx, UpsertRequest2),
  427:     
  428:     %% List policies
  429:     ListRequestPb = #'ListPoliciesRequest'{
  430:         tenant_id = TenantId
  431:     },
  432:     
  433:     ListRequest = flow_pb:encode_msg(ListRequestPb, 'ListPoliciesRequest'),
  434:     Result = router_admin_grpc:list_policies(Ctx, ListRequest),
  435:     
  436:     ?assertMatch({ok, _Response, _Ctx}, Result),
  437:     {ok, Response, _} = Result,
  438:     
  439:     ResponsePb = flow_pb:decode_msg(Response, 'ListPoliciesResponse'),
  440:     Policies = ResponsePb#'ListPoliciesResponse'.policies,
  441:     ?assert(length(Policies) >= 2),
  442:     
  443:     PolicyIds = [P#'AdminPolicy'.policy_id || P <- Policies],
  444:     ?assert(lists:member(<<"list_policy1">>, PolicyIds)),
  445:     ?assert(lists:member(<<"list_policy2">>, PolicyIds)),
  446:     
  447:     ok.
  448: 
  449: %% Test: UpsertPolicy and Router.Decide integration
  450: test_upsert_and_decide_integration(Config) ->
  451:     AdminKey = proplists:get_value(admin_api_key, Config),
  452:     TenantId = <<"integration_tenant">>,
  453:     PolicyId = <<"integration_policy">>,
  454:     
  455:     %% Create policy via Admin API
  456:     AdminPolicyPb = #'AdminPolicy'{
  457:         policy_id = PolicyId,
  458:         providers = [
  459:             #'AdminProvider'{id = <<"anthropic">>, weight = 1.0}  %% 100% anthropic
  460:         ],
  461:         sticky = false,
  462:         rules = []
  463:     },
  464:     
  465:     UpsertRequestPb = #'UpsertPolicyRequest'{
  466:         tenant_id = TenantId,
  467:         policy = AdminPolicyPb
  468:     },
  469:     
  470:     UpsertRequest = flow_pb:encode_msg(UpsertRequestPb, 'UpsertPolicyRequest'),
  471:     Ctx = create_context_with_auth(AdminKey),
  472:     {ok, _, _} = router_admin_grpc:upsert_policy(Ctx, UpsertRequest),
  473:     
  474:     %% Use Router.Decide with new policy
  475:     MessagePb = #'Message'{
  476:         message_id = <<"test_msg">>,
  477:         tenant_id = TenantId,
  478:         message_type = <<"chat">>,
  479:         payload = <<"Test">>,
  480:         metadata = [],
  481:         timestamp_ms = erlang:system_time(millisecond)
  482:     },
  483:     
  484:     RouteRequestPb = #'RouteRequest'{
  485:         message = MessagePb,
  486:         policy_id = PolicyId,
  487:         context = []
  488:     },
  489:     
  490:     RouteRequest = flow_pb:encode_msg(RouteRequestPb, 'RouteRequest'),
  491:     DecideResult = router_grpc:decide(Ctx, RouteRequest),
  492:     
  493:     ?assertMatch({ok, _Response, _Ctx}, DecideResult),
  494:     {ok, DecisionResponse, _} = DecideResult,
  495:     
  496:     DecisionPb = flow_pb:decode_msg(DecisionResponse, 'RouteDecision'),
  497:     %% Should route to anthropic (100% weight)
  498:     ?assertEqual(<<"anthropic">>, DecisionPb#'RouteDecision'.provider_id),
  499:     
  500:     ok.
  501: 
  502: %% Test: DeletePolicy and Router.Decide integration
  503: test_delete_and_decide_integration(Config) ->
  504:     AdminKey = proplists:get_value(admin_api_key, Config),
  505:     TenantId = <<"delete_integration_tenant">>,
  506:     PolicyId = <<"delete_integration_policy">>,
  507:     
  508:     %% Create policy
  509:     AdminPolicyPb = #'AdminPolicy'{
  510:         policy_id = PolicyId,
  511:         providers = [
  512:             #'AdminProvider'{id = <<"openai">>, weight = 1.0}
  513:         ],
  514:         sticky = false,
  515:         rules = []
  516:     },
  517:     
  518:     UpsertRequestPb = #'UpsertPolicyRequest'{
  519:         tenant_id = TenantId,
  520:         policy = AdminPolicyPb
  521:     },
  522:     
  523:     UpsertRequest = flow_pb:encode_msg(UpsertRequestPb, 'UpsertPolicyRequest'),
  524:     Ctx = create_context_with_auth(AdminKey),
  525:     {ok, _, _} = router_admin_grpc:upsert_policy(Ctx, UpsertRequest),
  526:     
  527:     %% Delete policy
  528:     DeleteRequestPb = #'DeletePolicyRequest'{
  529:         tenant_id = TenantId,
  530:         policy_id = PolicyId
  531:     },
  532:     
  533:     DeleteRequest = flow_pb:encode_msg(DeleteRequestPb, 'DeletePolicyRequest'),
  534:     {ok, _, _} = router_admin_grpc:delete_policy(Ctx, DeleteRequest),
  535:     
  536:     %% Try to use Router.Decide with deleted policy
  537:     MessagePb = #'Message'{
  538:         message_id = <<"test_msg">>,
  539:         tenant_id = TenantId,
  540:         message_type = <<"chat">>,
  541:         payload = <<"Test">>,
  542:         metadata = [],
  543:         timestamp_ms = erlang:system_time(millisecond)
  544:     },
  545:     
  546:     RouteRequestPb = #'RouteRequest'{
  547:         message = MessagePb,
  548:         policy_id = PolicyId,
  549:         context = []
  550:     },
  551:     
  552:     RouteRequest = flow_pb:encode_msg(RouteRequestPb, 'RouteRequest'),
  553:     
  554:     %% Should return policy_not_found error
  555:     try
  556:         router_grpc:decide(Ctx, RouteRequest),
  557:         ?assert(false, "Should have thrown grpc_error")
  558:     catch
  559:         {grpc_error, {Status, _Message}} ->
  560:             ?assertEqual(?GRPC_STATUS_NOT_FOUND, Status)
  561:     end,
  562:     
  563:     ok.
  564: 
  565: %% Test: Admin telemetry with correlation_id
  566: test_admin_telemetry_correlation_id(Config) ->
  567:     AdminKey = proplists:get_value(admin_api_key, Config),
  568:     TenantId = <<"telemetry_admin_tenant">>,
  569:     CorrelationId = <<"test-admin-correlation-id-67890">>,
  570:     
  571:     %% Create context with correlation_id
  572:     Ctx = create_context_with_auth(AdminKey),
  573:     CtxWithCorr = Ctx#{metadata => [{<<"x-correlation-id">>, CorrelationId} | maps:get(metadata, Ctx, [])]},
  574:     
  575:     %% Create test policy
  576:     AdminPolicyPb = #'AdminPolicy'{
  577:         policy_id = <<"telemetry_admin_policy">>,
  578:         providers = [
  579:             #'AdminProvider'{id = <<"openai">>, weight = 0.7}
  580:         ],
  581:         sticky = false,
  582:         rules = []
  583:     },
  584:     
  585:     RequestPb = #'UpsertPolicyRequest'{
  586:         tenant_id = TenantId,
  587:         policy = AdminPolicyPb
  588:     },
  589:     Request = flow_pb:encode_msg(RequestPb, 'UpsertPolicyRequest'),
  590:     
  591:     %% Capture telemetry events
  592:     HandlerId = make_ref(),
  593:     Self = self(),
  594:     Handler = fun(Event, Measurements, Metadata, _Config) ->
  595:         Self ! {telemetry, Event, Measurements, Metadata}
  596:     end,
  597:     
  598:     %% Attach telemetry handler for router_admin events
  599:     telemetry:attach(HandlerId, [router_admin, list], Handler, #{}),
  600:     
  601:     %% Call list_policies with correlation_id
  602:     ListRequestPb = #'ListPoliciesRequest'{tenant_id = TenantId},
  603:     ListRequest = flow_pb:encode_msg(ListRequestPb, 'ListPoliciesRequest'),
  604:     
  605:     %% First upsert policy
  606:     {ok, _, _} = router_admin_grpc:upsert_policy(CtxWithCorr, Request),
  607:     
  608:     %% Then list policies
  609:     {ok, ListResponse, _} = router_admin_grpc:list_policies(CtxWithCorr, ListRequest),
  610:     ListResponsePb = flow_pb:decode_msg(ListResponse, 'ListPoliciesResponse'),
  611:     ?assert(length(ListResponsePb#'ListPoliciesResponse'.policies) >= 1),
  612:     
  613:     %% Wait for telemetry event
  614:     receive
  615:         {telemetry, [router_admin, list], Measurements, Metadata} ->
  616:             %% Verify measurements
  617:             ?assert(maps:is_key(count, Measurements), "count should be present"),
  618:             ?assert(is_integer(maps:get(count, Measurements)), "count should be integer"),
  619:             
  620:             %% Verify metadata
  621:             ?assert(maps:is_key(tenant_id, Metadata), "tenant_id should be present"),
  622:             ?assert(maps:is_key(result, Metadata), "result should be present"),
  623:             ?assertEqual(TenantId, maps:get(tenant_id, Metadata), "tenant_id should match"),
  624:             ?assertEqual(ok, maps:get(result, Metadata), "result should be ok (not success)"),
  625:             ?assert(maps:is_key(correlation_id, Metadata), "correlation_id should be present"),
  626:             ?assertEqual(CorrelationId, maps:get(correlation_id, Metadata), "correlation_id should match"),
  627:             ok
  628:     after 1000 ->
  629:         ?assert(false, "Telemetry event not received within timeout")
  630:     end,
  631:     
  632:     %% Cleanup
  633:     telemetry:detach(HandlerId),
  634:     
  635:     ok.
  636: 
  637: %% Helper: Create context with authorization
  638: create_context_with_auth(AdminKey) ->
  639:     %% Create mock context with metadata
  640:     Metadata = [
  641:         {<<"x-api-key">>, AdminKey}
  642:     ],
  643:     %% grpcbox context structure (simplified for testing)
  644:     #{metadata => Metadata}.
  645: 
  646: %% Helper: Create context without authorization
  647: create_context_without_auth() ->
  648:     #{metadata => []}.
